result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sean Michael Schulz in court, in custody. Court makes stmt. Defendant request counsel and has provided SPD office w/ paperwork SPD will represent but have a conflict and will look for counsel for defendant. Defendant states he is willing to proceed without counsel. Defendant given Waiver to Attorney form. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:30 AM No Court Reporter - Taped.  Defendant Sean Michael Schulz in custody and appeared by video.   Special Prosecutor Amy Pautzke in court for State of Wisconsin. . SPD Spansail present in jail w/Deft. for bond call.  VWC Rachel Race is present and makes Stmt. on behalf of Victim.  Court reads complaint to Deft. given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Bond is set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
